dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 6156 IH: Child Care Small Business Insight and Improvement Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Landsman (for himself and Ms. Letlow) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Small Business

form.official-title: To require the Administrator of the Small Business Administration to designate a point of contact for for-profit child care providers, submit a report to Congress, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Child Care Small Business Insight and Improvement Act of 2023.

section.header: Report on for-profit child care providers

subsection.text: Not later than 120 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Administrator of the Small Business Administration shall submit to Congress a study and report on for-profit child care providers that includes—

paragraph.text: an assessment of the challenges and needs of such providers;
a description of the resources and support that the Small Business Administration provides to such providers;
any deficiencies in the resources and support described under paragraph (2); and
any recommendations for legislative actions necessary to address any challenges or needs faced by such providers that are identified by the report required in this subsection.

subsection.text: The Administrator of the Small Business Administration shall designate a full-time employee within the Administration as a point of contact for for-profit child care providers. Such employee shall—

paragraph.text: carry out the study required under subsection (a); and
provide recommendations to the Administrator on how to better deliver existing resources and support to for-profit child care providers.

subsection.text: The term for-profit child care provider has the meaning given the term eligible child care provider in section 658P of the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990 (42 U.S.C. 9858n) and is a provider that operates—

paragraph.text: in one or more of the several States or the District of Columbia.

subsection.text: No additional amounts are authorized to be appropriated to carry out this Act. This Act shall be carried out using amounts otherwise appropriated to the Administrator of the Small Business Administration.
